Starting Position: Begin by sitting comfortably on the floor or on a yoga mat in a cross-legged position. Ensure that your spine is straight and your shoulders are relaxed.
Cross-Legged Position: Place your right leg in front of the left one, allowing the right knee to be slightly higher than the left. Keep your feet flexed to protect your ankles.
Root Down: Ground your sitting bones evenly into the floor or mat, creating a stable foundation for the pose. Engage your core muscles to support your lower back.

Lengthen the Spine: Inhale deeply and elongate your spine, lifting the crown of your head towards the ceiling. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears.
Raise the Right Arm: As you exhale, reach your right arm up and over towards the left side, creating a gentle side stretch. Keep your left hand resting on the floor beside your left hip for support.

Side Stretch: Lean towards the left side, feeling a lengthening sensation along the right side of your torso. Avoid collapsing forward or backward; instead, maintain an upright position.
Open the Chest: Rotate your chest slightly towards the ceiling to open up the heart center. Keep your shoulders stacked vertically over your hips to maintain alignment.

Gaze: Keep your neck relaxed and your gaze soft. You can look straight ahead or gently turn your gaze towards the ceiling to deepen the stretch.
Breath Awareness: Focus on your breath as you hold the pose. Inhale deeply to create space in the side body, and exhale to release any tension or tightness.Hold and Breathe: Hold Parsva Sukhasana on the right side for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or longer if comfortable. Continue to breathe deeply and evenly throughout the pose.\n\n
